page.title: 07LANDSCAPE AND GEOLOGY
page.content: This area has gently rolling relief,though in the western part of the area there is a small valley through which runs a small stream. The area is covered by boulder clay, which was deposited in the Ice Age. At that time the whole area was covered by a great thickness of ice, carrying with it stones and clay from other areas, which were laid down when the glacier melted. The soil is mostly a mixture of clay, chalk and flints, though some parts are more sandy, but the soils have been much altered by farmers ploughing and adding fertilizers. Beneath the boulder clay is chalk, which means that the area has good drainage, with rainwater easily sinking into the ground.
